Epigraph

Then wear the gold hat, if that will mover her; If can bounce high, bounce for her too, Till she cry "Lover, gold-hatted, high-bouncing lover, I must have you!"


- Thomas Parke D' Invilliers.



Preface


The translation from text to emoji was fun, but took a little thought to convey the right message. Most emojis can explain themselves while others are harder to imagine what they could mean. Most of my emojis are pretty clear to read, it alos helps that this book uses a lot of imagery.

Emoji Translation Excerpt (page 198)



And as I sat there, brooding on the old unkown world, I thought of Gatsby's wonder when he first picked out the green light at the the end of Daisy's dock.
💺 👨🏻‍🦳 🌎  💚 🔆
He had come a long way to this blue lawn and his dream must have seemed so close that could hardly fail to grasp it.
➡️ 💙 🌾 💭 🚫 👊🏻 
He did not know that it was already behind him, somewhere back in that vast obscurity beyond the city, where the dark fields of the republic rolled on under the night.
👈🏻 👨🏻 👓 🏙 ⬛️ 🌾 🌚 
Gatsby believed in the green light, the orgastic future that year by year recedes before us.
💚 🔆 ➡️ 🗓 
It eluded us then, but that's no matter--tomorrow we will run faster, stretch out our arms farther... And one fine morning----
🔓 🗓  🏃‍♂️
